p: One of the first attempts to minimize the toxicity of lead-based perovskite materials was introducing the mixed-metal cation perovskites, thus decreasing the Pb atoms amount in the active material. In work [ 72] by Xiaoli Zhang et al., a set of CsPb 1−xSn xBr 3 NCs were synthesized. It was shown that with increase of Sn content the absorption and emission bands are blue-shifted. The best performance of LED based on mixed-metal cation perovskite material was achieved for Sn content of 0.3 with maximum luminance of 5495 cd m −2.
